classified_components.reasoning: The Engine is fundamentally required for the operation of Internal Combustion Engine (ICE) vehicles due to its role in fuel delivery, combustion, and engine-specific mechanics.

Although some aspects of the transmission are adapted in electric vehicles (such as the elimination of clutch and multi-speed gearbox for single-speed transmissions), the basic function of transferring power from the engine to the wheels remains unchanged.

Suspension system is a mechanical component that provides vehicle stability and ride comfort during motion, regardless of whether the powertrain is internal combustion engine (ICE) or electric vehicle (EV).
The steering system is a mechanical interface between the driver and vehicle, independent of the powertrain type.
